column4: Can anyone recommend me any RAM management programs in Ubuntu?

Some program to manage my ram more efficiently.. like shut down unused libraries and such. Because I find that if I close down all apps, I still won't get all the ram I'd have as if I'd reboot. And with only 512ram, running gnome+kde, everything counts
I don't know that anything of that sort exists...or is necessary
well, there are similar tools in windows.. I thought I wouldn't need here but it looks like I do
if you run kde apps in gnome, for example, even if you close the kde apps, the libraries still remain open unless you kill them
I can also close down all apps, and still have like 400mb of swap space in use, haha.
you can use top to see which apps are using the most memory
does apt-get autoremove do anything for you?
some of those dependencies might be in use by other programs, or there might be some other emacs stuff on your system
They aren't though, at least, they weren't before
what package did you remove when you removed emacs?
emacs22-bin-common or something like that might still be installed
Yay, reclaimed 67mb of my space. I'd say that package needs to be looked at :|
'emacs' is just a meta-package... yeah apt can be a pain like that sometimes
